title: SQL Aggregate Functions
subject: Database Management Systems
theory:
Functions that take multiple rows and return a SINGLE value.
Ignores NULLs (except COUNT(*)).

common_mistakes.correction: SELECT Name, MAX(Salary) is invalid without GROUP BY. Which Name should be shown?

interview_questions.question: Difference between COUNT(*) and COUNT(col)?
interview_questions.answer: COUNT(*) counts ALL rows. COUNT(col) counts separate non-NULL values in that column.

exam_notes: Input: Many rows. Output: One number.
